results.title: The microcircuit story / presented by Philips
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: The basic principles involved in the manufacture of microcircuits, such as epitaxial growth, diffusion, and the masking process are illustrated, as are some of their diverse applications in everyday life, eg. the control of machine tools, colour television, navigation of aircraft, etc.

results.title: The Mick Fleetwood story: Two sticks and a drum
results.creator_credit: Jason Wright, Creatvty and Richard Journo
results.brief_description: Informative and reasonably honest account of the life of Mick Fleetwood, drummer and leader of the legendary rock band Fleetwood Mac. Utilising stills, archival footage and a slew of interviews both with Fleetwood and his contemporaries, this work elucidates the incredible immoderation of a successful rock musician’s life. Drink, drugs, women, limousines, jet planes, extensive travelling parties, money — in short, excess of just about everything that is a feature of the lifestyle. Fleetwood admits the drugs were nearly his undoing as well as the (well documented) shifting relationships in the band and the claustrophobic environment of relentless touring and recording. Interviewees include: Lindsay Buckingham, Stevie Nicks and Christine McVie.

results.title: The Micallef programme [Series 2: episodes 1 - 3]
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Shaun Micallef, Gary McCaffrie and Ted Emery
results.brief_description: Lawyer turned comedian Shaun Micallef presents his own unique brand of humor in a series of sketches from his program along with fellow comedians Francis Greenslade, Wayne Hope and Roz Hammond. Items from three separate episodes include; Bud Smallhorn, passionate flag maker at the Old Glory Banner Company; Sexpo; Mark Wainwright, blind climber of Mt Everest; the politeness distance indicator; District Attorney Ferguson; Australia’s first male Miss Nude Australia; police corruption; farewelling a valued audience member; Dracula who wants to escape the rat race; meals on wheels; the search for the best laundry detergent and the Australian record domino attempt. Guests/special appearances by Tim Rogers, Kevin Harrington and Glenn Robbins.

results.title: The Miami experiment
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An American defence lawyer argues that his 15 year-old client is not guilty of murder. The plea is insanity, caused by exposure to television violence. The trial is the first major trial to be televised live during the proceedings. The case for and against this radical experiment is examined. A landmark use of television cameras inside a courtroom…an interesting overview and outcome from 1976. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Messengers: Laurie Lee
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Laurie Lee is interviews in Gloucester, England where he spent his childhood. He speaks of the early influence that made him take up writing and the autobiographical details involved in “Cider with Rosie”. Passages of this are read, accompanied by views of this valley where Lee grew up.

results.title: The Merry widow
results.creator_credit: Virginia Lumsden, ABC-TV (Australia) and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: This performance, sung in English, of Franz Lehar’s “The Merry Widow” was recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, February 23, 1988. The Baron Zeta attempts to obtain the Merry Widow Hanna Glawaris’ fortune for his impoverished country of Pontevedria by getting his companion Danilo to marry her. The sub plot deals with the flirtation between Valencienne, Zeta’s young wife and Camille, an officer. Features Joan Sutherland, Ronald Stevens and the Australian Opera Chorus. The performance is directed by Lofti Mansouri. Richard Bonynge conducts the Elizabethan Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: The Merry-Go-Round horse
results.creator_credit: Richard Balducci and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A little ragamuffin adores a wooden merry-go-round horse. One day the horse is replaced by a merry-go-round “car” to be bought for a wealthy child who abuses his new toy. The little ragamuffin, conspires with friends to rescue the wonderful horse. They are successful and as the boy throws his arms around the horse’s neck he rides away.

results.title: The Mermaids = Mei ren yu
results.brief_description:
A group of female swimmers train for competition. A crowd cheers on for Zhao Meiying. After training, Meiying meets with Jianqi, her fiancé.

The next day, as Meiying trains in an outdoor gym with her teammates, she is summoned to the director’s office. He tells her that the leaders have decided to send her abroad to Japan to learn “water ballet”(synchronised swimming), so she can return and form a team. Devastated that she can no longer compete in swimming, she takes to the pool and spends an entire day swimming laps, exhausting herself. When the director tries to approach her, she ignores him. Jianqi arrives to console her, and she breaks down in tears. He tells her that she must stand up to reality, because one cannot be an athlete their whole life.

Meiying arrives in Japan with another swimmer and Jiao Lan, a Japanese translator. Later that evening, they meet their trainer Ms Biko at the hotel to discusses figure swimming, a combination of swimming, music and dancing. The women practice all night in the pool, eventually falling asleep, where Ms Biko finds them the next morning. Ms Biko is impressed with their progress and ability to learn fast, and lets them rest for the day. They go to Ocean Park, a theme park, instead, where they watch sea lions and dolphins perform elaborate water tricks, inspiring them.

They return to China with a newfound passion for figure swimming. Meiying asks the director if she can coach a figure swimming team. He initially refuses, recommending she train beginners, but he eventually appears to yield. Meiying visits Gao Fengzhi and Wang Limei, convincing them both to join the team.

Meiying returns home to her new apartment with Jianqi. He brings up the topic of their marriage, and Meiying she explains that at the moment she is too caught up in her work to marry. She hopes he can wait for her.

Meiying approaches Jianqi’s younger sister Lilli, a ballet dancer, to join the team. She agrees. Training commences, and Meiying works her swimmers rigorously. Thanks to her strict coaching, however, the team rapidly improves. When Lilli asks Meiying why she is so strict with her pupils, she replies that it is for their own good. Jianqi arrives, and berates Lilli for neglecting her ballet duties in favour of the figure swimming team. He blames Meiying for encouraging her in the first place.

The next day at practice, Meiying continues to train her team rigorously. Visibly exhausted, she berates them for not smiling throughout their training. The girls threaten to quit, due to Meiying’s rigid coaching, no longer finding enjoyment in the sport. Upset and offended, Meiying wanders around town, crestfallen. She tries to visit Jianqi, but he ignores her and does not answer the door. She leaves. After her pupils search for her, they head to the swimming pool for late night practice. They find Meiying there, swimming laps, which she does to cheer herself up. The girls immediately apologise to Meiying for their inexcusable behaviour. She forgives them, glad to have the team back together. Lilli visits her brother Jianqi, and scolds him for ignoring Meiying when she needed his support the most. She asks him to apologise to her but he refuses.

The team continues to practice furiously, getting better by the day, and the performance looms closer. Given that Jianqi, a composer, is ignoring her, Meiying approaches the director to write some music for their performance. The day of the performance arrives, and the team is up against a number of equally talented groups. When Meiying thanks the director for writing the team’s music, he tells her that Jianqi insisted he write it. When it’s time to take the stage, the team performs a routine more elaborate and spectacular than any of the others before them. Meiying spots Jianqi in the crowd and smiles, forgiving him. The crowd erupts in applause at the end of the performance, and Meiying and Jianqi fight through the crowd to reach each other. THE END.

Key Scene:

End of Reel 3: The team’s final performance.
(3 stars - Aleena Glentis; November 2, 2012)

results.title: The Merchant of Venice (Perspective)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Shakespeare in Perspective Series”.
Designed to give greater understanding of the play by placing it in its historical and social context and by stressing its relevance for a modern day audience. Perspective offered by Wolf Mankowitz.
